channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: WATCH: Hegseth touts U.S military strength while swearing in new recruits
item.description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth touts the strength of the U.S. military during the Venezuela intervention while swearing in new recruits in Virginia.

item.title: Felon Milwaukee County Judge Resigns With Guaranteed Pension
item.description: A federal jury last month convicted Hannah Dugan of obstructing ICE agents attempting to arrest an illegal immigrant.

item.title: Hilton retreats after DHS accuses hotel of canceling bookings from immigration agents

item.title: Hegseth: America’s Military Is ‘Already Surpassing’ Last Year’s Recruiting Figures
item.description: 'We're setting new records at the War Department of historic recruitment of men and women wanting to join the ranks,' said War Secretary Pete Hegseth.

item.title: Fraud experts warn that criminals are exploiting aid agencies in every state

item.title: What to Do with California’s Billionaire Tax Proceeds
item.description: A health-care union’s ‘one-time fix’ for federal Medicaid cuts could easily become permanent.

item.title: Tim Walz Departs on a Deluge of Fraud
item.description: The Minnesota governor was brought down by the consequences of his own irresponsible profligacy.

item.title: Beijing’s Long Game Meets Washington’s Gamble
item.description: Venezuela has become a proving ground for the emerging world order.

item.title: After Making Money On ‘America 250,’ The NFL Will Go Back To Hating The USA
item.description: Any patriotism on display by the NFL over the next few months will be, at best, a bait and switch.

item.title: California GOP Rep. Doug LaMalfa dies at 65
item.description: California GOP Rep. Doug LaMalfa has died at age 65, a top Republican said Tuesday.

item.title: Tim Walz’s Unsurprising Two-Step from the Political Stage
item.description: The financial scandals that long shadowed the Minnesota governor finally caught up to him.

item.title: Bugs Not a Feature
item.description: The week of December 29, 2025: Insect disappointment, the debt, silver, California’s proposed wealth tax, and more.
